questions.text: when you are dressed to go out and you tell him/her to get his/her shoes, does he/she understand?
If you point at something, what does your child typically do?
If you say, “Show me your shoe” without pointing, making gestures, or giving hints (when you are not going out or getting dressed), does your child show you his/her shoe?
If you say, “Bring me the blanket” or ask for another object without pointing, making gestures, or giving hints, does your child bring it to you?
If you say, “Put the book on the chair” without pointing, making gestures, or giving any other hints , does your child put the book on the chair?
